intro: Adamea stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited adamea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive, waxy texture. The fruit is a capsule that opens to release seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its natural habitat.
